TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MappedByteBuffer extends Java.Nio.ByteBuffer

Docs.summary: MappedByteBuffer is a special kind of direct byte buffer which maps a region of file to memory.

remarks.para: MappedByteBuffer is a special kind of direct byte buffer which maps a region of file to memory.
MappedByteBuffer can be created by calling . Once created, the mapping between the byte buffer and the file region remains valid until the byte buffer is garbage collected.

All or part of a MappedByteBuffer's content may change or become inaccessible at any time, since the mapped file region can be modified by another thread or process at any time. If this happens, the behavior of the MappedByteBuffer is undefined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.MappedByteBuffer Force() cil managed

Docs.summary: Flushes changes made to the in-memory buffer back to the mapped file.

remarks.para: Flushes changes made to the in-memory buffer back to the mapped file. Unless you call this, changes may not be written back until the finalizer runs. This method waits for the write to complete before returning.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Java.Nio.MappedByteBuffer> ForceAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if there is a high probability that every page of this buffer is currently loaded in RAM, meaning that accesses will not cause a page fault.

remarks.para: Returns true if there is a high probability that every page of this buffer is currently loaded in RAM, meaning that accesses will not cause a page fault. It is impossible to give a strong guarantee since this is only a snapshot of a dynamic situation.

Docs.summary: Attempts to load every page of this buffer into RAM.

remarks.para: Attempts to load every page of this buffer into RAM. See .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
